overview_of_class: This course will introduce students to representative works of nineteenth-century German literature in their historical and literary contexts. The readings will move through the periods of Weimar Classicism, Romanticism, Young Germany, Realism, and Naturalism, focusing on the dramatic political, emotional, and intellectual upheavals in German culture during this century. The course also provides an introduction to literary analysis in German, and gives an overview of various literary genres used in the nineteenth century such as poems, novellas, stories, and novels.
name: Introduction to Literature: 1800-1900

descriptions.value: This course will introduce students to representative works of nineteenth-century German literature in their historical and literary contexts. The readings will move through the periods of Weimar Classicism, Romanticism, Young Germany, Realism, and Naturalism, focusing on the dramatic political, emotional, and intellectual upheavals in German culture during this century. The course also provides an introduction to literary analysis in German, and gives an overview of various literary genres used in the nineteenth century such as poems, novellas, stories, and novels.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Two years of college German or equivalent

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
- Gain familiarity with some of the standard works of German literature of the nineteenth century
- Understand German intellectual and political history of the nineteenth century
- Deepen appreciation for literary techniques and styles in German
- Develop skills in critical reading and literary analysis
- Improve German reading, writing, and speaking skills
